arm_group.description: We compare the efficacy of amniotic membrane and hydrocolloid in same subjects to avoid confounders.
Same subjects received amniotic membrane and hydrocolloid dressing at the same time in different wound.

brief_summary.textblock: Bovine amniotic membrane may show better efficacy than hydrocolloid dressing.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Efficacy of Bovine Freeze-dried Amniotic Membrane on Wound Healing in Laser Treatment

detailed_description.textblock:
Bovine amniotic membrane as a biological dressing can be applicable to wound after laser
      treatments. Comparing with hydrocolloid dressing material, which is the most widely used
      after laser treatment now, amniotic membrane will show better efficacy. Thus, with amniotic
      membrane, epithelization time will shorten and redness which is usually left after laser
      will disappear quickly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Skin lesions treatable by ablative lasers

          -  More than two skin lesions of similar size at the same area

          -  Available during the study period (2 weeks)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Taking steroid or nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug, isotretinoin

          -  underlying diabetes mellitus, keloid or any malignancy

intervention.other_name: Laser ablation of the skin lesions
dressing with hydrocolloid as a comparator

facility.name: Department of Dermatology, Seoul National University College of Medicine

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Effects of Bovine Freeze-dried Amniotic Membrane and Hydrocolloid on Epithelialization After Laser Treatments

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Dermatology, Seoul National University College of Medicine
Department of Dermatology, Seoul National University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: time to complete epithelization after wounding

reference.citation: Singh R, Chacharkar MP. Dried gamma-irradiated amniotic membrane as dressing in burn wound care. J Tissue Viability. 2011 May;20(2):49-54. doi: 10.1016/j.jtv.2010.06.001. Epub 2010 Jul 8.
